briefTitle: A Comparison of Once a Day Dose Compared to 2 Doses/Day
officialTitle: A Multi-center, Investigator-blinded, Randomized, 12-month, Parallel-group, Non-inferiority Study to Compare the Efficacy of 1.6 to 2.4 g AsacolÂ® Therapy QD Versus Divided Dose (BID) in the Maintenance of Remission of Ulcerative Colitis
summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy in maintaining remission of ulcerative colitis between a once daily (QD) Asacol regimen and a divided, twice daily (BID) Asacol dosing regimen.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Remaining in Remission at Month 6, ITT Population, Determined by the Simple Clinical Colitis Activity Index (SCCAI)
